com.aevi.payment

Class FinancialRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.helpers.BundleWrapper
      • com.aevi.payment.AeviRequest
        • com.aevi.payment.FinancialRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DepositRequest, MoToPaymentRequest, MoToRefundRequest, PaymentRequest, PreAuthorisationRequest, RefundRequest, TokenRequest

    public abstract class FinancialRequest
extends AeviRequest
    Base class for the different financial request types. For specific requests, see PaymentRequest, RefundRequest MoToPaymentRequest, MoToRefundRequest, PreAuthorisationRequest and DepositRequest.

      • Fields inherited from class com.aevi.payment.AeviRequest

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrency

        public java.util.Currency getCurrency()
        Gets the currency for the request. May be set to null, in which case the payment application will revert to its default currency.
        Returns:
        payment currency. May be null.

      • setCurrency

        public FinancialRequest setCurrency(java.util.Currency currency)
        Sets the currency for the request. The caller should check whether the desired currency is supported by the payment application using the PaymentAppConfiguration class.

        Note that the currency may be set to null, in which case the payment application will revert to its default currency.

        Parameters:
        currency - payment currency. May be null.

      • getAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getAmount()
        Returns the amount as a BigDecimal.
        Returns:
        the amount as a BigDecimal

      • setAmount

        public FinancialRequest setAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Sets the amount of the transaction. Setting the amount to zero, or to a negative number will result in an InvalidAmountException being thrown. Amounts should be given in whole cents, fractional cents (i.e. $0.005) will also result in an InvalidAmountException.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount as a BigDecimal
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount is null
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount is zero, negative, or has fractional cents.

      • setMerchantId

        public FinancialRequest setMerchantId(java.lang.String merchantId)
        Sets the merchant with whom to process the transaction. May be set to null to indicate that any merchant can complete the transaction.

        It is up to the application developer to verify that the merchant ID given is valid. The PaymentAppConfiguration object can be used to obtain a list of valid merchant IDs.

        Parameters:
        merchantId - merchant ID. May be null.

      • getMerchantId

        public java.lang.String getMerchantId()
        Returns the merchant with whom to process the transaction. Null indicates that any merchant can complete the transaction.

        It is up to the application developer to verify that the merchant ID given is valid. The PaymentAppConfiguration object can be used to obtain a list of valid merchant IDs.

        Returns:
        merchant ID. May be null if no merchant is selected.

      • setAcceptedAccountTypes

        public FinancialRequest setAcceptedAccountTypes(AccountType... accountTypes)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Restricts the types of Account that will be accepted by the App for the Financial Request. If left unset or an empty set is provided, any Account type will be accepted.

        Note that including AccountType.UNDEFINED in the parameters will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        accountTypes - AccountType Array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getAcceptedAccountTypes

        public AccountType[] getAcceptedAccountTypes()
        Returns the Account types that will be accepted App for the Financial Transaction.

        Returns:
        AccountType Array. An empty set implies that all AccountTypes are supported.

      • setAcceptedCardTypes

        public FinancialRequest setAcceptedCardTypes(CardType... cardTypes)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Restricts the types of card that will be accepted by the App for the Financial Request. If left unset or an empty set is provided, any Card type will be accepted.

        Note that including CardType.UNDEFINED in the parameters will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        cardTypes - CardType Array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getAcceptedCardTypes

        public CardType[] getAcceptedCardTypes()
        Returns the card types that will be accepted App for the Financial Transaction.

        Returns:
        CardType Array. An empty set implies that all Card types are supported.

      • setAcceptedCardEntryTypes

        public FinancialRequest setAcceptedCardEntryTypes(CardEntryType... cardEntryTypes)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Restricts the acceptable methods by which card details can be captured for the Financial Request. If left unset or an empty set is provided, any capture type will be accepted.

        Note that including CardEntryType.UNDEFINED in the parameters will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        cardEntryTypes - CardEntryType Array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getAcceptedCardEntryTypes

        public CardEntryType[] getAcceptedCardEntryTypes()
        Returns the types of card capture that will be accepted App for the Financial Transaction.

        Returns:
        AccountType Array. An empty set implies that all AccountTypes are supported.

      • getExtraReferences

        public TransactionReferences getExtraReferences()
        Gets the extra references for the transaction. Returned as a TransactionReferences \ set.

        Note that the given transaction reference values are copied.

        Returns:
        the TransactionReferences provided for the transaction.

      • setExtraReference

        public FinancialRequest setExtraReference(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Adds an extra reference code for the transaction.

        Extra references are predominantly optional are typically used by Banks for proprietary functionality. Further information on any extensions available for use by App Developers may be obtained from the relevant Bank or Acquirer.

        Note that the given transaction reference values are copied.

        Parameters:
        key - the key of the transaction reference as a String. This parameter must not be null.
        value - the value of the transaction reference as a String. This parameter must not be null.
